title: Top Places to Visit in Gonda, Uttar Pradesh
content:
Gonda district is one of the districts of Uttar Pradesh, India. The city of Gonda is the district headquarters, and also the administrative centre for the Devipatan Division.

 

With an area of 3,404 square kilometres (1,314 sq mi), Gonda has borders with Shrawasti district to the north, Balrampur and Siddharthnagar districts to the northeast, Basti district to the east, Faizabad district to the south, Bara Banki district to the southwest, and Bahraich district to the northwest. The district lies between 26° 47' and 27° 20' north latitude and 81° 30' and 82° 46' east longitude.

 

Industry

There are several sugar mills, rice mills and many other small industries and handicraft industry. One of the India's six Indian Telephone Industries is situated at Mankapur, and the largest sugar mill in India is situated at Kundarkhi.

 

In 2006 the Ministry of Panchayati Raj named Gonda one of the country's 250 most backward districts (out of a total of 640). It is one of the 34 districts in Uttar Pradesh currently receiving funds from the Backward Regions Grant Fund Programme (BRGF).

 

Degree colleges

All colleges of Gonda are affiliated with Faizabad University.

 

Meena Shah Degree College - First Regular Profession Degree College of Gonda City.

Generation Next Place For Computer Education Gonda City.

subContents.SubTitle: 1. Ram Leela Bhawan
subContents.SubContent: Ram Leela Bhawan is one of the famous tourist spot present in Gonda. It is situated at Colonelganj, Uttar Pradesh 271502. People from different places come here to watch the drama. If you are in Gonda then you should be visiting this place.

subContents.SubTitle: 2. Tikri Reserved Forest
subContents.SubContent: Tikri Reserved Forest is a Nature Preserve in Gonda which is located at State Highway 9, Ashrafabad Tangiya, Utraula, Gonda, Uttar Pradesh, India. It is a beautiful place with many natural sceneries and attractive natures beauties. If you are in Gonda then this is a place you should be visiting.

subContents.SubTitle: 3. Religious places
subContents.SubContent:
There are many Religious places present in Gonda. Few of them are as below:

 

Shri Shyam Mandir, Durga Mata Temple

Old Hanuman Garhi, Nagababa Mandir

mata ka mandir, Shivji Ka Mandir

Naveen Galla Mandi, bhakt prahlad mandir

sankat mochan hanuman, Noora Mal Mandir

dukh haran nath mandir, New Hanuman Garhi

ma kali bhavani temple, Kali Bhawani Mandir

St Thomas Church

subContents.SubTitle: 4. How to Reach
subContents.SubContent:
BY BUS

 

You can easily get regular buses to Gonda from other major cities of the country.

Bus Station(s): Gonda

 

BY TRAIN

 

Gonda is well connected to other major cities of the country via regular trains.

Railway Station(s): Gonda Junction (GD)

 

BY FLIGHT

 

There are no regular flights from other major cities of the country to Gonda. Nearest airport is Amausi Airport.

Gonda

107 km away

Amausi Airport (LKO), Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh

Gonda

147 km away

Gorakhpur Airport (GOP), Gorakhpur, Uttar Pradesh

Top Places to Visit in Ballia, Uttar Pradesh
recommendations.content: Ballia is a city with a municipal board in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh bordering Bihar. The eastern boundary of the city lies at the junction of two major rivers, the Ganges and the Ghaghara. The city is situated 140 km (87 mi) east of Varanasi. Bhojpuri is the primary local language. recommendations.content:
Auraiya is a city and a municipal board in Auraiya district in the state of Uttar Pradesh, India. It is district headquarters as well. NH 19 passes through the center of the town. Dibiyapur RS is nearest Railway Station. Saifai Airstrip is nearest airport.

recommendations.title: Top Places to Visit in Varanasi with family.
recommendations.content: Varanasi, also known as Benares, Banaras, or Kashi, is a city on the banks of the Ganges in the Uttar Pradesh state of North India, 320 kilometres (200 mi) south-east of the state capital, Lucknow, and 121 kilometres (75 mi) east of Allahabad.
